From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From es- +‎ tirar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [əs.tiˈɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [es.tiˈɾaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)
  • Rhymes: -a(ɾ)

Verb

[edit]

estirar (first-person singular present estiro, first-person singular preterite estirí, past participle estirat)

  1. (transitive) to stretch, stretch out
    Synonym: allargar
  2. (transitive) to pull
    • 1968, Lluís Llach, “L'estaca”:
      Si estirem tots, ella caurà / I molt de temps no pot durar / Segur que tomba, tomba, tomba / Ben corcada deu ser ja. / Si jo estiro fort per aquí / I tu estires fort per allà / Segur que tomba, tomba, tomba / I ens podrem alliberar.
      If we all pull, it will fall / And it can't last very long / It's sure to fall, fall, fall / It must be quite rotten already / If I pull hard this way / And you pull hard that way / It's sure to fall, fall, fall / And we'll be able to free ourselves.

[edit]

gerund estirant

singular estirat estirada
plural estirats estirades

Derived terms

[edit]
  • a tot estirar
  • estira-i-arronsa
  • estiracabells
  • estiracordetes
  • estirada
  • estirament
  • estirar-se
  • estirat
  • estireganyar
  • estiregassar

Further reading

[edit]
  • “estirar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007

Galician

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From es- +‎ tirar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /estiˈɾaɾ/

Verb

[edit]

estirar (first-person singular present estiro, first-person singular preterite estirei, past participle estirado)

  1. to stretch; to elongate
    Synonyms: estarricar, estricar

Conjugation

[edit]

[edit]

Portuguese

[edit]

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /is.t͡ʃiˈɾa(ʁ)/ [is.t͡ʃiˈɾa(h)], /es.t͡ʃiˈɾa(ʁ)/ [es.t͡ʃiˈɾa(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /is.t͡ʃiˈɾa(ʁ)/ [is.t͡ʃiˈɾa(h)], /es.t͡ʃiˈɾa(ʁ)/ [es.t͡ʃiˈɾa(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /is.t͡ʃiˈɾa(ɾ)/, /es.t͡ʃiˈɾa(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /iʃ.t͡ʃiˈɾa(ʁ)/ [iʃ.t͡ʃiˈɾa(χ)], /eʃ.t͡ʃiˈɾa(ʁ)/ [eʃ.t͡ʃiˈɾa(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /es.t͡ʃiˈɾa(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /(i)ʃ.tiˈɾaɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /(i)ʃ.tiˈɾaɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /(i)ʃ.tiˈɾa.ɾi/

  • Hyphenation: es‧ti‧rar

Verb

[edit]

estirar (first-person singular present estiro, first-person singular preterite estirei, past participle estirado)

  1. to stretch
  2. to extend, elongate

Conjugation

[edit]

Derived terms

[edit]
  • estiramento

Descendants

[edit]
  • → Bengali: ইস্তিরি (istiri), ইস্ত্রী (istri)
    • → Assamese: ইস্ত্ৰি (istri)
    • → Odia: ଇସ୍ତ୍ରୀ (istri)
  • → Gujarati: ઇસ્ત્રી (istrī)
  • → Hindustani: (see there for further descendants)
    Hindi: इस्त्री (istrī)
    Urdu: اِسْتْری (istrī)
  • → Kannada: ಇಸ್ತ್ರೀ (istrī)
  • → Konkani: इस्त्री (istrī)
  • → Marathi: इस्त्री (istrī)
  • → Sindhi: استري (istarī)
  • → Telugu: ఇస్తిరి (istiri), ఇస్త్రీ (istrī)

[edit]
  • “estirar”, in Dicionário Priberam da Língua Portuguesa (in Portuguese), Lisbon: Priberam, 2008–2025
  • Xavier, Anthony Soares, transl. (1936) [1913], Portuguese Vocables in Asiatic Languages, Baroda: Oriental Institute, translation of Influencia do Vocabulario Português em Línguas Asiáticas by Sebastião Rodolfo Dalgado (in Portuguese), →ISBN, page 151, column 1

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From es- +‎ tirar.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /estiˈɾaɾ/ [es.t̪iˈɾaɾ]
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: es‧ti‧rar

Verb

[edit]

estirar (first-person singular present estiro, first-person singular preterite estiré, past participle estirado)

  1. to stretch
  2. to extend

Conjugation

[edit]

gerund estirando
past participle masculine feminine
singular estirado estirada
plural estirados estiradas

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
